label: Pepper__bell___Bacterial_spot
title: Bell Pepper - Bacterial Spot
description: Dark spots on leaves and fruit caused by Xanthomonas bacteria. Spots may have yellow halos and can cause defoliation.
treatment: Apply copper-based bactericides; remove infected plant debris; avoid overhead watering.
prevention: Use certified disease-free seeds; practice crop rotation; ensure good air circulation; avoid working with wet plants

label: Pepper__bell___healthy
title: Bell Pepper - Healthy
description: No visible disease symptoms. Plant appears healthy with normal leaf color and structure.
treatment: Continue regular care with proper watering and nutrition; monitor for early signs of disease.
prevention: Maintain good garden hygiene; provide adequate spacing; use drip irrigation; rotate crops annually

label: Potato___Early_blight
title: Potato - Early Blight
description: Dark concentric spots on older leaves caused by Alternaria fungus. Can progress to stems and tubers.
treatment: Remove infected foliage; apply fungicides containing chlorothalonil or copper; improve air circulation.
prevention: Use resistant varieties; rotate crops; avoid overhead irrigation; mulch to prevent soil splash; remove plant debris

label: Potato___Late_blight
title: Potato - Late Blight
description: Water-soaked lesions on leaves that turn brown/black. White fungal growth on leaf undersides during humid conditions.
treatment: Apply fungicides immediately; remove infected plants; avoid overhead watering during cool humid weather.
prevention: Plant certified seed potatoes; ensure good drainage; provide adequate plant spacing; monitor weather conditions

label: Potato___healthy
title: Potato - Healthy
description: No visible disease symptoms. Leaves are green and healthy with normal growth pattern.
treatment: Maintain routine nutrition and irrigation; monitor regularly for disease symptoms.
prevention: Use certified seed potatoes; rotate crops; practice good sanitation; ensure proper soil drainage

label: Tomato_Bacterial_spot
title: Tomato - Bacterial Spot
description: Small dark spots with yellow halos on leaves. Spots on fruit are raised and scabby.
treatment: Apply copper-based sprays; remove infected plant material; use drip irrigation instead of overhead watering.
prevention: Use certified disease-free seeds; practice 3-4 year crop rotation; avoid handling wet plants; ensure good air circulation

label: Tomato_Early_blight
title: Tomato - Early Blight
description: Brown spots with concentric rings on lower leaves. Can cause yellowing and defoliation.
treatment: Apply fungicides containing chlorothalonil; remove affected leaves; stake plants for better air flow.
prevention: Use resistant varieties; mulch around plants; avoid overhead watering; ensure adequate plant spacing

label: Tomato_Late_blight
title: Tomato - Late Blight
description: Large brown lesions on leaves and stems. White fuzzy growth on leaf undersides in humid conditions.
treatment: Apply fungicides preventively; remove infected plants immediately; avoid overhead irrigation.
prevention: Choose resistant varieties; ensure good air circulation; avoid watering leaves; monitor weather conditions

label: Tomato_Leaf_Mold
title: Tomato - Leaf Mold
description: Yellow spots on upper leaf surface with olive-green fuzzy growth on undersides. Common in humid conditions.
treatment: Improve ventilation; reduce humidity; apply fungicides if severe; remove affected leaves.
prevention: Use resistant varieties; ensure good air circulation; avoid overhead watering; maintain proper plant spacing

label: Tomato_Septoria_leaf_spot
title: Tomato - Septoria Leaf Spot
description: Small circular spots with gray centers and dark borders. Black specks (fruiting bodies) visible in spot centers.
treatment: Remove infected lower leaves; apply fungicides containing chlorothalonil or copper; mulch soil surface.
prevention: Use certified seeds; practice crop rotation; avoid overhead irrigation; stake plants for air circulation

label: Tomato_Spider_mites_Two_spotted_spider_mite
title: Tomato - Spider Mites
description: Fine webbing on leaves with stippled yellow appearance. Tiny mites visible on leaf undersides.
treatment: Spray with insecticidal soap or neem oil; increase humidity around plants; remove heavily infested leaves.
prevention: Avoid over-fertilizing with nitrogen; maintain adequate moisture; encourage beneficial insects; regular inspection

label: Tomato__Target_Spot
title: Tomato - Target Spot
description: Circular brown spots with concentric rings resembling targets. Can affect leaves and fruit.
treatment: Apply fungicides containing chlorothalonil; remove infected plant debris; improve air circulation.
prevention: Use resistant varieties; practice crop rotation; avoid overhead watering; mulch to prevent soil splash

label: Tomato__Tomato_YellowLeaf__Curl_Virus
title: Tomato - Yellow Leaf Curl Virus
description: Upward curling and yellowing of leaves. Stunted growth and reduced fruit production. Transmitted by whiteflies.
treatment: Control whitefly populations with insecticides or yellow sticky traps; remove infected plants.
prevention: Use virus-resistant varieties; control whitefly populations; use reflective mulches; inspect plants regularly

label: Tomato__Tomato_mosaic_virus
title: Tomato - Mosaic Virus
description: Mottled light and dark green patterns on leaves. May cause leaf distortion and reduced yield.
treatment: Remove infected plants; disinfect tools; avoid handling plants when wet; control aphid vectors.
prevention: Use virus-free seeds; control aphid populations; practice good sanitation; avoid tobacco use around plants

label: Tomato_healthy
title: Tomato - Healthy
description: No visible disease symptoms. Plant shows normal green foliage and healthy growth pattern.
treatment: Continue regular care with proper watering fertilization and pruning; monitor for early disease signs.
prevention: Use certified seeds; practice crop rotation; maintain good garden hygiene; provide adequate nutrition and water
